intro: Acmella pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf spurge or small spurge, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and diverse growth forms. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, with simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its compact size and ornamental potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens as a ground cover or filler plant.
